p: On autopsy, lung findings post-ARDS seem fairly uniform across the three diseases (Xu et al. 2020). Common features include epithelial desquamation and regeneration, and diffuse alveolar damage, possibly due to direct damage from the virus (Nicholls et al. 2006). One case report of a COVID-19 patient who succumbed to ARDS noted pathologic changes in the liver (microvascular steatosis), which may have been either due to the virus itself, or drug-induced (Xu et al. 2020).
